page.name: Hosted Private Cloud
page.page_description: Welcome to the Hosted Private Cloud status page for real-time information on system performance and availability.
page.headline: Hosted Private Cloud OVHcloud Status : incidents, maintenances
page.notifications_email_footer: You received this email because you are subscribed to Hosted Private Cloud's service status notifications.

components.name: Backup as a Service || Veeam Backup Managed

incidents.name: [RBX8][Hosted Private Cloud] - R808R26/R808R27
incidents.message: Start Time : 13/01/2023 10:44 UTC End Time : 13/01/2023 13:15 UTC Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX8 Root cause : Maintenance link that caused an electrical issue. All services are operational since 13:15 UTC.

incidents.name: [RBX8][Hosted Private Cloud] - R808R26/R808R27
incidents.message: Start Time : 13/01/2023 10:44 UTC End Time : 13/01/2023 12:51 UTC Service impact : Servers were temporarily unavailable in racks R808R26 and R808R27 Root cause : Electrical issue

incidents.name: [Scheduled] [Global][VMware Private Cloud] - vCenter minor upgrade
incidents.message: Start time : 09/01/2023 07:00 UTC End time : 12/01/2023 17:00 UTC Service impact : The management plane will be unavailable for 1 hour during the maintenance schedule. Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our infrastructure, we are rolling an upgrade for the VMware vCenter Server Appliance solution. The operation will be done by pool. A communication will be send to inform customers of their specific schedule.
incidents.timestamp: Jan <var data-var='date'>9</var>, <var data-var='time'>07:00</var> - Jan <var data-var='date'>12</var>, <var data-var='time'>17:46</var> UTC

incidents.name: [Global][VMware] - VMware Remote Console
incidents.message:
The solution we were working on is now being deployed progressively on all infrastructures as part of our usual & automatic upgrade process.
In the meantime, you can still use the "Web Console" available in your vSphere Web Client.

As previously indicated, if you previously changed the configuration to use the "legacy connection mode", you'll have to remove the custom configuration on your workstation, refer to the note below for more information.
